text: The mechanism by which early lymphoid cells are selectively transformed by <extra_id_0> v-Abl <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is currently unknown .

Previous studies have shown constitutive activation of <extra_id_0> IL-4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> IL-7 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> signaling pathways , as measured by activation of <extra_id_0> Janus protein kinase (JAK)1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> JAK3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , STAT5 , and <extra_id_0> STAT6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , in pre-B cells transformed by <extra_id_0> v-Abl <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

text: To determine whether activation of these cytokine signaling pathways by <extra_id_0> v-Abl <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is important in the cellular events induced by the Abelson murine leukemia virus , the effects of <extra_id_0> IL-4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> IL-7 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> on pre-B cells transformed with a temperature - sensitive <extra_id_0> v-Abl <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mutant were examined .

Whereas <extra_id_0> IL-4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> had little or no effect , <extra_id_0> IL-7 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> delayed both the apoptosis and cell cycle arrest that occur upon v-Abl kinase inactivation .

<extra_id_0> IL-7 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> also delayed the decreases in the levels of <extra_id_0> c-Myc <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> Bcl-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , and <extra_id_0> Bcl-xL <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> that occur upon loss of v-Abl kinase activity .

text: <extra_id_0> IL-7 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> did not maintain <extra_id_0> v-Abl <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - mediated differentiation arrest of the pre-B cells , as activation of NF-kappaB and RAG gene transcription was unaffected by <extra_id_0> IL-7 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

These results identify a potential role for <extra_id_0> IL-7 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> signaling pathways in transformation by <extra_id_0> v-Abl <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> while demonstrating that a combination of <extra_id_0> IL-4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> IL-7 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> signaling can not substitute for an active <extra_id_0> v-Abl <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> kinase in transformed pre-B cells .
